attributes.action: Allow our prisoners a fighting chance through Covid 19 & a future
attributes.additional_details:
Ever heard the saying two wrongs don't make a right ? 
stop treating them all same & help progress their future by changing our approach.
covid a problem in prisons at Highpoint prison its lack of dedication to covid 19 has had One wing A spur &B spur during the 1st lock down not mixing during food/exercise yet allowing them to cross spurs to socialise defeating the object. now they have an outbreak 
tag costs $9 a day prison costs $118 a day let them home give them a chance keep them safe
attributes.background: give our prisoners a chance to be safe during this pandemic free low risk prisoners and keep them on tag Provide the correct training to HMP probation service needs help closely monitor how the prisons are run ensure rules are being followed stricter interviews on employing  staff

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331465

###Further information

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
